column4: hi guys ... i can't change my screen-resolution ... can you guys help me?
Do you have the proper drivers installed for your graphics card?
Interesting, it doesn't specify to use the nvidia driver
Are you sure nvidia is enabled in hardware drivers?
... hardware drivers doesn't show me a thing
How did you install the nvidia drivers again ( or am I thinking of the wrong person? )
Ahh, Ok let me see if I can edit your xorg.conf and send it back to you
the nvidia-logo showed up ... and then parts of the screen were blank ... after a while a small part became visible ... all was very slow ... the mouse-cursor didn't move for a while
I am not sure, possibly try envyng if you havn't already
... what do i have to do?
Not sure if it will help, but install envyng from synaptic / apt then use it ( Applications -> System Tolls I think ) to install the newest nvidia drivers
